concept_data.title: capacity to have rights and obligations

summary: The concept of "capacity to have rights and obligations" is fundamental in EU civil law, denoting the legal ability of individuals or entities to possess rights and assume obligations. This capacity is essential for engaging in legal transactions, entering contracts, and participating in legal proceedings. In the EU regulatory framework, it ensures that parties can be held accountable for their actions and can seek legal remedies. The capacity to have rights and obligations is a prerequisite for the exercise of legal personality, which is crucial for the functioning of both natural persons and legal entities within the EU legal system.
